title: Sam Burgess should be hailed as one of Britain's most successful ever sporting exports
text:
How mischievously those sporting gods play their games, how fiendishly they weave their scripts. So, just a few days before England march into a World Cup final, Sam Burgess, the scapegoat held up in some quarters as responsible for England’s last World Cup disaster, feels forced to announce his competitive retirement prematurely at just 30 years of age.

You could and would not write it, unless you were devoid of heart. Or, indeed, possessed a vendetta

Of course, no-one but the irrationally bitter should view it this way and they will definitely not in large sections of north England or in the overwhelming majority of Australia.

They will simply see Burgess’ announcement as what it is - the...
description: How mischievously those sporting gods play their games, how fiendishly they weave their scripts.
